Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JayemkayCanberra
Reviews.Content: Hotel Astrid is in a great location. Emerging from Charles de Gaulle etoille station and looking up at the Arc de Triomphe was a real 'pinch me' moment, especially when we could stick our heads out the window and see the same view! Our room was pleasant, well presented and maintained, but while both the room and bathroom were clean, neither were particularly large. The bathroom, though small was relatively newly renovated and the shower pressure very good. We spent little time in the room - after all we were in Paris! Breakfast was quite adequate (good even) with fresh, fruit salad, a couple of cereal choicees, bread rolls, croissant, brioche, cold meat, cheese, yoghurt and juice. Our only complaint would be that we found the staff to be aloof and not always very friendly. That said, we would stay there again for the location and overall value for money. Oh, and there is a coin laundry on the next block (diagonally across the road and first street on right).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: YJScq
Reviews.Content: This is a three-star hotel, which means that the lobby and room are small, the elevator is tiny, and the stairwell close to un-negotiatable.The room key is just that - a key not a card, and in fact an old fashioned lever tumbler key. However, the location is great (from my window I saw the Arc de Triomphe), the staff friendly, and spoke perfect English, the breakfast lovely, and the price very reasonable. The in-room WiFi was fast and stable (although it required registering with your home address and email, apparently for legal reasons). I would highly recommend the Astrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to Arc de Triuph”
Reviews.Author: Oxana D
Reviews.Content: We've chosen this hotel becouse of the price. It was really best price for such a hotel in Paris. What we liked: friendly staff, tasty breakfast, good location What we dislike: very small rooms and very hard and tough bed (I had a back ache every morning).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slightly better than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: luwi28
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights this month. The location of the hotel is brilliant!! You couldn't ask for more. Right in the middle of it all. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was very old and dated, don't expect too much. Our room was extremely small, on arrival we could hardly get the bedroom door open because of the bed being right there behind the door. Always very clean though. Breakfast is nothing to shout about if u don't want cheese and ham for breakfast your limited to a boiled egg! Perfect hotel for a short break,would recommend. *****warning****** at the top of the street where the hotel is, near the arch de triumph you will be approached by a man (kosovan, slovakian I think he said) he claims to of found a gold ring on the floor and gives it to you as a gift, DO NOT TAKE!! it's a con he will give you the ring then ask for euros! There are several of these guys around the arch they work in a circle approaching tourists. just ignore and say no. We had it happen to us and see it happen so many times in our 3 night stay. Nothing against the hotel what so ever as you'd get that anywhere you stay. Other than that a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Top location and the room is adequate”
Reviews.Author: JasonNyilas
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel in the heart of Paris. The location is to die for. You can have an unobstructed view of the Arc de Triomphe if you stick your head out of the bathroom window and look to the right. Avenue Carnot leads off the Champs Elysees and is incredibly quiet by Paris standards. The restaurants in the neighbourhood are very Parisienne and very well priced. The rooms themselves are nothing to shout about. When I was there, the lift didn't work and I was staying on the top floor!!!! Five flights of narrow stairs was not a lot of fun with all my bags. All I required was a good night's sleep and the beds are tired, didn't stay flat and were creaky every time I moved. The bathroom by contrast appeared newly tiled and refurbished. The breakfast area and food are great. The family who runs the hotel are very friendly too. A quirky kind of hotel with some charm thrown in. I wouldn't stay here if it wasn't good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie M
Reviews.Content: As others have said, great location but the best part is the staff - helpful and friendly. My room was fine if a little small but it was clean and had a brilliant shower. It was good being able to access my emails on the computer near the entrance. I would definitely stay here again as long as they could promise me that it won't be minus 10 degrees in Paris while I'm there!

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: croatiabuddy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Astrid is situated in an ideal spot for walking, metro travel and good inexpensive restaurants and bars. Our room was quiet and very comfortable with a king size bed, good shower etc - highly recommended. The breakfast was excellent with all the usual bread, pastries, cheese, ham, fruit salad etc and wonderful, plentiful coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: weekendescapes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Astrid for 3 nights in September 2011 and would recommend it for its loaction and value for money. From the airport we caught the Air France bus (departs from each terminal every 30mins) to Charles de Gaulle-Étoile, which was a 5 minute walk downhill to the Hotel. The hotel is on a quiet street in an excellent location, with the Arc De Triomphe a 5 minute walk away, from here the main train lines into the city and towards the Eiffel Tower are accessable by lift or stairs. The hotel building itself is old, but the rooms are nice, with a comfortable bed, desk, small wardrobe and sitting table/chairs by the large window which when open could see the Arc De Trimophe from. The bathroom was clean, and included a bath. We found the Staff to be very friendly, helpful and spoke very good english. Free wifi. Breakfast in the hotel included a continental buffet, and there were many restaurants and cafes within walking distance and a grocer around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “November stay 2011”
Reviews.Author: alex s
Reviews.Content: I had a really enjoyable stay at this hotel.Both the room and bathroom were impeccably clean. Although a relatively small room it had everything you could possible need, there was a large, comfortable bed and nice area to sit by the window and watch people go by. The shower was fantastic and there was even the option of a bath. Staff were friendly and the free breakfast was a bonus. We even had a view of the Arc de Triomphe from our balcony window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justin F
Reviews.Content: My husband nd I are spending our Holiday in Paris with another couple and our mini schnauzer. We loved this hotel. Great rate, great location, and super friendly staff. Everything that we were looking for in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: goforit52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Astrid. We were given a room on the 6th floor (top). The room was small but had a balcony which we liked. The bed was king sized and very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and had recently been refurbished. The only criticism I would have was the frosted glass in the bathroom door. We prefer not to be visible when on the toilet!! Dont stay here if you are not on very close terms with your travelling companion! Breakfast was super and the staff were friendly and helpful. Probably the very best thing about this hotel is its location. It's a short walk up the hill to Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro and RER. The street is one of the many which fan out from the Arc de Triomphe but it is quite quiet traffic wise.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: RZleb
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly service, clean, good value for money. Walking distance from arc de triomphe and champs elysee. You can take the bus from the airport that stops at the begining of rue carnot instead of taking a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Be”
Reviews.Author: mfb
Reviews.Content: This cosy hotel is located a hop skip and a jump away from the arc de Triomphe, if you are the athletic type that is. Otherwise it's less than five minutes walk from said arc with a Metro stop before the arc. There are two brasseries within seconds of leaving the hotel, a good patisserie, a small epicerie and a good butcher where you might be tempted to buy a roast chicken to beat the high cost of restaurants. The room was not large but the bed was, as we requested. It was also a nonsmoker's room so it didn't stink. The bathroom had been recently refurbished, there was a safe, free wifi and for those who need it, air conditioning. It was more than adequately heated the weekend we were there, which happened to be unseasonably warm, or as things look now probably seasonally warm, global warming taken into account. The breakfast was decent with yogurts, several cheeses, ham, coffee with hot milk or without, you choose, real juice, several types of bread, regular sized croissants and pain chocolat, (not the usual over-sized type, neither of which I sampled so cannot attest to their quality). The breakfast room is pleasant a with a large television that thankfully, only played a screen saver. The one criticism I'd have of the breakfast room is that stylish though the chairs were, they were too low for the tables and the stools were a tad small for regular-sized butts but not of course for the pert little butts everyone aspires to. Staff were helpful. Rooms were clean. Breakfast personnel worked hard to keep up and spoke English. A good solid bed with no street noise with the window closed. Charming view of street and Arc de Triomphe. The hotel's location was a plus because everything was within walking distance (if you are a walker) and otherwise the Metro was close at hand. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 9 days while I was in France for business. I picked this hotel because it was close to two Metro lines, so I could go to work. Also my wife wanted a hotel that was close to shopping and restaurants while I was away at work. This hotel met both our needs and more. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There was free wifi and breakfast and very clean, comfortable rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris for business or fun.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: CarberyMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights around October 1st. Nice little hotel near the Arch de Triomphe. Small room with modern and decent size bathroom. We were glad for the A/C because it was a hot spell in Paris. Easy walk to Metro, buses and shopping. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only complaint was that they forgot to tell us that breakfast was included on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “great value close to main metro station”
Reviews.Author: britwit007
Reviews.Content: nice hotel near main metro station and arc de triumph. also in nice area. beds and pillows very comfy. hotel staff very friendly and helpful. closer to airport so our taxi ride only cost us 40 euros from airport. don't bother with the shuttle buses- they will cost you just as much as a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the Triumph Arch....”
Reviews.Author: mandy004
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the end of August when Paris is over-crowded and although there was a misunderstanding regarding our rooms the staff was super-helpful to solve the problem. The rooms are tiny but clean. The microscopic-size rooms in Paris are a known symptom, so we were not bothered; moreover we are normal-weight persons. But if you have a slight over-weight you will surely have problems having your shower in a match-box size cabin. The breakfast was good. Try not to sleep with your window open because the street is crowded and you will hear cars, night conversations, early morning shoutings in French. Just close your window and enjoy your cosy bed. The most amazing thing is that you can actually view the Triumph Arch from your window and that compensates all. We will come back to this hotel if our business place will be in the neighbourhood like it was in this September.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: Jan G
Reviews.Content: Together with my wife and my friends we stayed at Hotel Astrid very close to Arc de`Triomphe. Nice hotel with very friendly staff. Jan and friends

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French experience and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience a French, quaint hotel close to everything and the subway, then this is a good place. It is not an American style hotel. Rooms are small, service is scant and extras are not readily available. But the breakfast which was included was great. Good wi-fi and free. Internet/computer available in the lobby. One staff member friendly and helpful -Guillermo (William). Location and price will determine if you would like this place. We didn't mind because we were there for the experience and not in the room that often.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: dscStLouis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located by the Arc de Triumph. The personel is very helpful with directions and recommendations. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoubyLouBristol
Reviews.Content: Tucked in just next to the Champs Elysees and within sight of the Arc de Triomphe, it was a real find. Perfect location for exploring Paris and so quiet it was unbelievable. It was great to have a comfy room, delicious breakfast and wifi for such a good price. It was also close to the RER and Metro and the Air France transfer bus to the airport is just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Peperj
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights before coming home. It's near the Arc du Triomphe and the Etoile metro station. The room is not big, but is similar to the other Paris' old buildings. It has the necessary for a brief stay, the breakfast is good with different types of french cheeses and the balck coffee is far away from the american way, that is very good for the lovers of strong and dark coffees. The only things we didn't like are the noisy creaking floor and the shower because it got wet all over the bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in fabulous location for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: DStravelbugs
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's first time in Paris so this was the perfect hotel to introduce him to the sights and sounds of Paris. I had worked in Paris and vacationed there several times and also really enjoyed this hotel and its location. The hotel is very comfortable for all the reasons other reviewers mentioned -- clean and comfortably sized rooms and bathrooms (for Paris), good breakfast, polite staff, surprisingly quiet for being one or two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, etc. Check for last minute deals on their website. Those prices are for stays later that week or next week and can be a signficant savings, especially over several days. The location is fabulous. With good weather, comfortable shoes, and lots of time, we walked to the Tour Eiffel, Louvre, Notre Dame, Jardin Luxembourg, and places in between (e.g. window shopping down George V, Rue de Rivoli, Rue du Fauberg St. Honore, etc). It's very easy to walk out to the Champs Elysee in the evenings to join in on the people watching and window shopping. And our picture of the Arc de Triomphe lit up at dusk is one of our favorite pictures. Transportation is very convenient from here with the metro station nearby and the Air France airport bus stop a block or two away. We arrived in Paris via Gare du Nord. The taxi ride for the two of us with our two suitcases came out to almost 30 euros. I'm not sure if that's the right price as the taxi drove north a bit and then came down towards the hotel. Maybe it's to avoid the traffic near the Champs Elysee. (Or maybe the ride seemed longer than necessary because of the angry and offensive rap music the taxi driver was playing.) There are various restaurants, little shops and bakeries nearby. We had trouble finding a boulangerie and grocery stores serving locals at local prices like we found in other parts of Paris. But that's to be expected given that the hotel is so near the tourist sites. Would recommend this hotel to our friends and family interested in sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: slm53
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at a special online rate that included breakfast. It appeared that there was some renovation work going on near my room, which probably explains the rate. It was a smallish room, but did have a private bath with shower. The location is just a short walk from the Arc de Triomphe, and the Air France shuttle to the airport stops right on avenue Carnot, a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Lovely and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage2007
Reviews.Content: We wheeled our luggage from the gare right down to our hotel door. Great location, a little pricey since we got charged in Euros and not dollars that we paid for on travel zoo. I didnt try to rectofy it. the room was spacious, classical paris architecture, lovely balconies, right next to a cafe and across from a patisserie. All kinds of little conveniance stores are tucked away in side streets. Right off of Champs D'Elysees. It was a wonderful trip and coming back to our room was always nice. Good breakfast as well. The only drawback was housekeeping would not respect your privacy and the room had tiny tvs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: GK23Charlotte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a week in may 2011. We arrived at the hotel 3-4 hours before our check in time, but were too jet-lagged to go sight see. We requested an early check in at the reception, and they were quite understanding. They gave us our room as soon as it became available, and I can't tell you how wonderful a clean bed feels when you have been flying for 10 hours! Our room faced the street and it had nice big east-facing windows, both in the room as well as the bathroom. The morning sun would light up the bathroom which made everything appear clean and fresh. I have never stayed in a hotel room which had a nice sunny bathroom!!! I LOVED it! The breakfast was quite good and filling, by Europe's standards. The location great too. There are 2 alimentation generale (general stores) just outside the hotel, which is extremely convenient. We would buy bottled water for just 1 euro from there. All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here - great hotel with espectacular location”
Reviews.Author: PatoyVicky
Reviews.Content: This was hotel was reccomended by a friend and it was excellent. 3 blocks from the Triumph Arc and 2 blocks from the metro station. Reception staff was very friendly. The room was small but good enough for europe standards. On the other hand, the bathroom was great. Compared with the tiny small european hotels bathroom, this one was brand new, big (even with bathtub) and very nice. Breakfast was included and the breakfast area(with 5-6 tables) was the nicest part of the hotel. Very confortable and the food variety was very good and very tasty. The price was very good compared with what other similiar hotels charge and included a good internet connection. As the title of my review say "you must stay here". You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “superb place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete_G0S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a romantic Paris trip with my girlfriend and it was loveley. All hotel staff friendly and helpfull. Great loaction nr transport links (1 min walk from Charles de Gaulle – Étoile). Few bars and resteraunts near by. Would def recommend Yuppies Café, 13 rue Montenotte 75017 Paris (5 mins walk) and for a reasonably cheap beer local style.. bar l'etoile d'argent on Rue d'Armaille (2 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value for money and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Terranovas
Reviews.Content: Heard dreadful remarks about hotels in Paris, we jump to tripadvisor and we did our homework. Found this hotel, well located, not just close to the "Arc de Triomphe" with Metro and RER line, but also at the end of our stay we took "Les Cars" to CGD. Also there is a bus service to Orly. Our room was small but perfect for our 4 nights, clean, LCD TV with French DVB and BBC.A double bed and hard mattress, as I like. The bathroom en suite, with a new shower and clean. Avenue Carnot was quiet and you could sleep with a open window. The breakfast was buffet style, ham, cheese, croissants, yoghurt, simple but fantastic to walk and "survive" Paris until the late afternoon. The staff was helpful and friendly. Sadly the elevator was broken after our arrival. The staff frankly told us that it will difficult to be fixed on the Eastern holidays. We have to go up and down the 6 floors, but no problem for me. They gave as a voucher for a free tour on one of the Senna ships and at the end of our stay they made us a discount.Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “it is in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: fara046
Reviews.Content: it is in the best location,nice staff and very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelWatchBangalore
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Paris and stayed in the hotel for two days during November 2010. I booked it through a local contact. The location of the hotel is amazing – as you come out of the hotel you can see Arc de Triomphe, I took the photo of this great monument from my balcony and it looks beautiful. The biggest benefit for me was the accessibility to Metro Station which is just a few yards from the hotel, I was able to see many parts of Paris and at the same time was able to come back to the hotel take rest and then venture out again. Another plus point was the staff fluency in English and their helpful nature. Staff provided all help in guiding me for travel spots and restaurants. I will be always grateful to them to help identify two Indian Restaurant which are very nearby “Santoor” and “Rath”. Both restaurants are good for great Indian Food. Rooms are not big but comfortable. I will definitely recommend this as well as stay next time when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dallasbc
Reviews.Content: The location and buffet breakfast were outstanding, lots of cafes,wine bars nearby,1 block from the metro. Sure the rooms were tight and dated but clean with a modern bath and warm!! Staff were very friendly and not carrying cases up 4 flights was nice(thereis an elevator) Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, close to the famous landmarks of Paris”
Reviews.Author: helces
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris with my 19 yr old daughter and we shared a great mother-daughter time. The price of the hotel included a cruise of the Seine for two and is one of the reasons I chose this hotel. I am so glad we did, it was just half a block from the Arc de triumph, and the metro. We walked down the Champs de Lysees and crossed the Alexandre Bridge. It was magnifique. A full breakfast was also included so it saved us a lot of money. The room was clean, with comfortable twin beds, a big bathroom, had high internet, and most important, it was air conditioned. A treat after those hot summer sightseeing days. I would definitely recommend the Astrid Hotel and hope to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the volcano...”
Reviews.Author: thefourwatsons
Reviews.Content: We met our friends in Paris France. We were one of the last planes to land before Charles de Gaulle closed. This perfect boutique hotel had all the charm that I had hoped for while staying in Paris. Our room was spacious by European standards and overlooked the street with a view of Arc de Triomphe. Our stay at the Astrid included a river cruise and upon the suggestion of the hotel staff we went at dusk. It took my breath away. Our hotel was close to the train and in walking distance of the Eiffel tower. I would recommend a trip to Basilique du Sacre Coeur if you don't mind heights. The hotel breakfast was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and breakfast with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: breezebythesea
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in late June. Though this is not the hotel my friend and I intend to book in the beginning, we're happy with it after a 3-night stay there. Location: very close to Arc de Triomphe. This is good as we travelled from CDG by airport shuttle, where the station is within 5 minutes' walk from hotel. Same for the Metro station. Environment: the lobby is elegantly decorated with paintings; there're cafes nearby but in general quite Staff: speaks English very well (I knew little French)... that calmed me down; also very helpful and nice Room: size is just ok but the washroom is really small; TV and some furniture are really old but still in good condition; the room is clean though Breakfast: very nice, variety of food more than I expected for a traditional continental breakfast Value: considering the location, service, breakfast and friendy staff, this hotel is of good value

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great, but Expensive Area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: rchs20
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on a Travelzoo promotion which gave us a free Seine cruise. They may offer this to all guests, but it seems like you have to ask. Staff at desk was good and bad. We had one woman who was terrific and two other people that were not great. The staff for breakfast/ cleaning staff were very nice. Breakfast was light fare, but great bread, croissants and cheese. Perfect area, about 500 yards away from Arc de Triumph and really close to Champs de Elysee. The Metro stop closest is Charles de Gaulle Etoile, but we walked everywhere. There is a restaurant, L'Arc, attached to the building, but not affiliated with the hotel. We did not eat there, but had drinks and dessert. Pretty nice place. L'Ecluse is a wine bar across the street and was very nice, but expensive. Staff at both places were very nice. We had a superior room which was small, but the bathroom was decent size. Rue de Carnot can be somewhat loud, especially on weekends. Overall, a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njm54
Reviews.Content: Small, but nice hotel. Beds are hard and pillows are flat, but clean. No traffic noise, convenient location. Staff was only moderately friendly. They were helpful when asked, but otherwise didn't offer any help, directions, etc. One young lady in particular was "all business" and didn't offer any "extra" advice. The breakfast is very good and is plenty. I liked the location (near the Arc) and the Arc was in view from our window. But i'm not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandieck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the subway station, clean, has an elevator,a very good breakfast, a shower (hard to find in France), free internet with computer in the lobby, and very helpful staff!! I was able to get a deal off of Travel Zoo to my cost was very reasonable. As you walk from the Metro the hotel is on the left near the end of Carnot (street names change with nearly every block). The rooms are small, (that's the norm) but it wasn't too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi, better than usual brakfast”
Reviews.Author: mr-ashenden
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for two times now and for the price they ask, it is very good value in this area of Paris. Pros: great location (close to the Arc de Triomphe and lots of pubs, cafes, food stores and one electronics/book store nearby), free wifi in every room (access codes available in the lobby), very friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast (not your usual Paris style continental, but with several cheeses, ham and salami, fruit salad and freshly pressed orange juice), early check-in available when your room is ready Cons: The rooms are rather small (but that's typical of Paris), no mini-bar in the room, the blanket was made of some artificial fibres (poly-sth) so I kept waking up sweating during the night, the only english channel was BBC' All in all I will definitely stay in hotel Astrid again when I'm on a business trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Flip_switch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days at the end of December. The location is wonderful! It is convenient to just about everything. A few steps from the hotel you have access to the Metro or you can walk just about anywhere else. The rooms are small but comfortable. Each room is equipped with a safe should you need it. Room keys at the hotel are actual keys and not the electronic cards so common these days. You will have to leave it with the receptionist when heading out. The staff is helpful and fluent in English. The breakfast in the morning is great. Variety of cheeses, ham, salami, abundance of bread, cereals, fruits, boiled eggs, coffee, tea, and fresh squeezed orange juice. The fresh orange juice is quite good. The Air France shuttle to/from airports is located just up the street - economical and convenient option. I

Reviews.Title: “Little nicer than a hostel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahsanfran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and weren't expecting luxury, but we weren't expecting a hostel type hotel either. Expect your room to be tiny, the decor to be extremely tired,and horribly uncomfortable bed and sheets. I think it would be fine for early twenties travelers, but if you have traveled quite a bit and are used to any kind of thread count spend the extra couple hundered bucks and stay somewhere nicer. We wish we would have. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't comfortable by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Great location of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPhoenix
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online though parshotels.com. We arrived very late do to missing our connecting flight in London because of security concerns. The desk manager was very friendly and check us in and gave us the key to our room in less than a minute. Our room was large by Paris standards with a great bathroom and view out our window. The free breakfast was cold items such as cereal, pastries and ham. Coffee and tea as well as orange juice were also provided. The hotel is family owned and very clean. The elavator made moving bags easy, and the staircase was beautiful. Its about a block from the Arch de Triamuph and next to a cafe. There is a bakery , small store and several other resturants across the strreet. Its close to the metro, and the Champs Elyesse . The people at the hotel, both desk, owner and maids are all friendly. I will stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: AnnaH15
Reviews.Content: This hotel/ bed and breakfast was wonderful and delightful. Peering out of my hotel window I could see the Arc de Triomphe right up the Avenue Carnot. The neighborhood was fantastic for exploring. The service was great as well. This hotel added to the wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel conviniently located”
Reviews.Author: CndnTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conviniently located in the nice neibourhood 3-5 minutes walk from two metro stations, Air Canada bus stop to CDG airport and Arc de Triomphe. One of the nearby metro stops connected to several metro lines which is very convinient. The new La Defense district is just few stops away where you can find a huge shopping mall (not as high fashion as La Fayette, but containing shops like Gap, H&M, Zara, Auchan). Hotel is very clean with a decent size rooms (I stayed in a single room), a good breakfast is served in the morning, including cheeses, yogurts, honey, coffee, tea, ham, breads. There are also a couple of restaurants and bakeries nearby. I was pleasantly suprised when I got there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: kkybs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and very convenient. Step out of the hotel and look up the street at the Arc de Triomphe and just a few minutes walk from the shopping end of the Champs Elysees. Area is quiet with many small resturants and pubs. Hotel is comfortable and breakfast was good, but limited. Definitely a good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and clean, comfortable room although small...”
Reviews.Author: samwong
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Astrid Hotel for 4D3N from 15-18Nov. The location of the hotel is Superb. Located along Ave Carnot. Very near (within 5 mins walk) to Metro station and Arch De Trioump (walk abt 5mins) and Champ Elyeees St. (less than 10 mins) Very easy to move around. Very nice. I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth23
Reviews.Content: If I went back, I might stay in the Latin Quarter, but this hotel is very convenient to the metro and we booked with a travelzoo.com special which provided a great rate with lots of extras. The breakfast was very convenient and good the staff was very helpful and polite. The room was very comfortable and I enjoyed the wireless access to make additional plans. The room opened out onto the street which was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: TrekkerMom09
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Astrid. My 7-year old daughter and I were visiting Paris for the first time, and the hotel was perfect for our needs. It was clean, very close to the Metro and Air France airport shuttle, and the staff were helpful (the desk staff all spoke English, but were also patient with my French). The free internet access was useful for looking up train schedules and checking in for our flight home. Our room was not large, but it was comfortable and well-kept. My daughter loved the breakfasts, especially the pain au chocolate. If you are looking for a centrally-located, good bet on the Right Bank, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right hotel for us.”
Reviews.Author: bcfrein
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and the location perfect. The Seine boat ride was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Steet with Incredible / Central Location”
Reviews.Author: warden364
Reviews.Content: We didn't realize that the Metro was so close until our second day but it was only a short walk to the top of the street. The street was lovely and quiet, yet right next to the Arch and Champs de Elysee. Included in the price of the room was a polite and helpful staff and a Seine river cruise (from the base of the Eiffel tower). The rooms were clean and well appointed but typically Parisian (small). The bathroom was a very nice tiled room that was disproportionately large for the size of the bedroom but we aren't complaining! The breakfast room was a modern design and the food was very good and varied. The cook came in early on our last day, as we were leaving earlier than they usually open, and she wanted to make sure we didn't travel hungry. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lapartier
Reviews.Content: I had a positive experience at Hotel Astrid. The location is great--a few blocks from the Arc de Triumph and surrounded by many cafes and easy metro access. The price was very reasonable and included breakfast. I would stay there again. The room furniture is a bit outdated but the bed was comfortable enough. The staff at front spoke English and were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel with Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: RexRain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Astrid near the Arc de Triomphe for 6 days total. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny. But the rooms are clean and the bathrooms are very modern. The staff at the front desk were more than willing to help us plan our daily activities with spot on recommendations. The continental breakfast was filling and satisfying. They had fresh breads, croissants, cheeses, cold meats, hard-boiled eggs, cereals and yogurts. They served fresh coffee or tea. The orange juice is superb. The price was 112 euro per night for two people. Included with the room was a free river boat cruise on the Seine. On the morning of check-out we were leaving at 5:30 to catch the train to Brittany. The concierge had prepared coffee and breads for us to enjoy before we left. The hotel is a short walk from the Metro station entrance which is on the same Avenue Carnot. The Air France bus stop is also on this street. It ferries passengers from Paris to CDG airport. We found the hotel to be perfect for our Paris adventure. There are 3 restaurants, a bakery, a butcher, and a small market within feet of the hotel. I will come back again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a first time Paris Visit”
Reviews.Author: TravelsPDX
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel off a travel website offering a reduced rate. The hotel was very easy to find on a street adjacent to the Arc. The Air France Shuttle #2 from CDG stops directly up the street for ~15 euro per person. Four major metro/train lines meet at the Arc so exploring Paris from the hotel. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The only problem I had was their credit card machine was not working at checkout and I had to run to the ATM to pay at checkout. The room was small but comfortable, clean, and air conditioned. Paris has so many attractions that we honestly spent very little time in the room. The breakfasts were simple though very good. We were on the second floor and thought the street noise was minimal even on the 14th of July.(Bastille Day). The restaurants in the area, however, appeared to be quite expensive and touristy. Even though the metro was easily accessible we might spend our next visit in one of Paris' more quaint neighborhoods. Of note,(this does not apply to the hotel itself), we ordered a few cappuccinos at the bakery kitty corner to the hotel, and had a terrible experience. As we left, the woman at the counter accused us of not paying.(even though we had). After about 5 minutes of arguing, she finally remembered and apologized.

Reviews.Title: “Homey little place”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonTraveler60
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with our stay at the Hotel Astrid. This is a cute, old hotel that has been well kept, and it's just down the street from the Arc! The rooms were fine and clean. The breakfast room was light and airy, and the front desk staff were a bit aloof, but helpful.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: maripassos
Reviews.Content: My husbad and I stayed at this hotel in our honeymoon. The hotel is exactly what we wanted! Lovely, charming and well located. An european way of life! The breakfast is delicious! The croissants are unforgetable. It is a few steps from the metro station and the Trioumphe Arc. In front of the hotel you can find an excelent boulangerie (baker). We really, really love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful French Experience in the right location”
Reviews.Author: dfogerty
Reviews.Content: The beds were old and tired but the place was clean and the staff were delightful. The location was great, easy to find your way home just find the Arch. Breakfast was good, wished for a bit more hot food.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: justaguy55
Reviews.Content: Room small, bathroom clean and well appointed. Staff rude and unhelpful. Location good, but very loud outside on weekend nights.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ruddoug09
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris to spend a romatic weekend with my wife and opted to stay at Hotel Astrid after finding the free river cruise offer via Travelzoo. The hotel is in a brilliant location, close to the metro and the Arc d'Triomphe with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby. At night times, do not be tempted to go up the hill towards the Arc d'Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, instead, come out of the hotel and head down the hill. When you get to the bottom turn right and you will see a huge street lined with many cheaper restaurants and bars. We found a brilliant american style restaurant, the name of which escapes me but it is on the right hand side of the road as you head away from the hotel. We'll definitely be back to the Astrid, the staff are very helpful and despite the room being a tad on the small side (characteristically Parisian), we loved every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Character, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: victorylow
Reviews.Content: I spent a total of three nights in Hotel Astrid and, in a nutshell, is a very nice hotel to stay at. I was in France for business and had three nights in Paris. A colleague suggested the Hotel Astrid mainly for its location but also for its cleanliness and helpful staff. My colleague was right on all fronts. The hotel is located a long block from the Arc de Triomphe. It is where the Air France bus (Bus number 2 to Arc de Triomphe) from the airport dropped me off so I only had to walk a long block to reach my hotel. I also had the option to take the RER/Metro, which is also conveniently located by the hotel (the M1 line will take you down to the Louvre, Palias Royal, and Bastille, the M6 line will take you towards the Eiffel Tower, both a 10-15 min train ride). Once settled, exploring began and it is wonderful to walk an 2 blocks to find yourself at the top of the Champs Elysee. The room is clean and small. I, personally, do not have a problem with small rooms however, a larger individual may find the rooms uncomfortable, including the beds which tend to be on the shorter side. The first room I stayed in had a bath tub so if you prefer showers, you should ask before checking in or as you check in. There is a television in the room with cable (the BBC is my friend) and a telephone. The key, like every other hotel in France, is unique and the front desk requires you to leave it whenever you leave the hotel. Just don't forget your room number. In conclusion, if the price works for you, you should stay at the Hotel Astrid. The location is its main advantage but it didn't hurt that they had clean, abeit small rooms and really nice staff. Grade: A

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mandy079
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Astrid for 3 nights in March this year. The rooms were smaller than average but fully equipped with a full bathroom. The bed was rock hard and I woke every morning a little stiff. They offer wifi internet for free if you take your laptop (which is safe in the room when you are out sightseeing). There is a small safe in the room for passports and valuables. We were facing the street so if we stuck our head out the window we had a lovely view of the Arc de Truimphe. Breakfasts were served in the diningroom area or you could ask them to send it up to your room for lazy days although these breakfasts are not full breakfasts that you would get downstairs. There are many restuarants in the area and little shops around to get other goodies you may require. English TV is non existent unless you want to count CNN. We could not find DVD shop anywhere around the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. We used the Paris Shuttle service which we booked online to get to our hotel. Upon arriving we noticed that the airport bus has a service which you can use that is very close to the hotel. The Open bus tour stops just up the road from the hotel at the Arc so it is easy to get on and off and view all attractions that Paris has to offer. We were very happy and would go back again if we had another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good staff”
Reviews.Author: carlsbadca
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Paris in February for his business trip. We found a great deal for this hotel on TravelZoo. It was basic 3 star, which translates to 2 star American. The smallish hotel is located on perhaps the quietest of the 12 avenues (spokes) that radiate out from the Arc de Triomphe "star" in the 17th arr. The hotel is one long block (slightly uphill) from the Arc, which is where the metro (Charles de Gaulle/Etoile station) is located. Not too bad. The hotel and room were very clean with a modern bathroom including hairdryer. Free WiFi was terrific for my boyfriend. The staff was very helpful. We ran out of the thin continental toilet paper one day, called down to the lobby, and a roll was delivered to our door within 10 minutes. A pretty good continental breakfast was included each day. Fresh brewed coffee and tea, fresh orange juice (I believe blood orange), several cereals, several pastries including croissants, pain au chocolat, boiled ham, and a rather fatty salami(?). This was served in a modern breakfast room which was an extension of the lobby. Also included were 2 tickets for the Seine River cruise starting from the base of the Eiffel Tower. We just showed our tickets to the man at the gangplank and we were onboard! Personally, I would have preferred a hotel located in the Saint Germain or Marais area, but this location was fine. Overall, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel ,great location .”
Reviews.Author: mini041
Reviews.Content: great hotel we just spent three nights there very clean, tidy good breakfast continental but plenty to chose from ;bedroom not bad really for paris big enough for two people very nice very clean with nice finishing touches .the avenue it is on is quiet but you are two minute walk from arc de triomphe which can be seen from the hotel windows at the front. there is a metro station on the same avenue on other side of the street would stay in this hotel again but would take a travel kettle next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Astrid
HotelInfo.Address: 27 Avenue Carnot | 17 Arr., 75017 Paris, France
